intro: Tetrastigma mindanaense, commonly known as the Mindanao grapevine, is a climbing vine native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into clusters of berries. Its botanical features make it suitable for ornamental purposes and traditional uses. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in forest understories.
